questions.question_text: New case tasks use the following prefix:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Following upgrade to the New York release:
New case tasks use the CSTASK prefix.
Existing tasks, regardless of state, use the TASK prefix.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/reference/r_CSCaseFormRelatedLists.html

Selected Answer: C
C Is Correct.

Tasks that have been created for this case by the customer service agent or agent manager. When you create a task or change the state of a task, the information is recorded in the case Activity field.
When you create a case task, the system generates a task number with a prefix. Following upgrade to the New York release:
New case tasks use the CSTASK prefix.
Existing tasks, regardless of state, use the TASK prefix.

choices.D: No specific task prefix just existing TASK prefix

questions.question_text: When are child cases updated from the parent case?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C. Automatically upon update of parent

Explanation: "enter information about the major case. This information is added as additional comments to each of the newly created child cases. "

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/create-child-cases-for-major-case.html

choices.D: When the Sync scheduled job runs
choices.A: Clicking on the Child Sync UI

questions.question_text: Which of the following features are specific to CSM Workspaces and will not be found in the Platform UI view? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
- Agent Assist:

Agent assist is available on the Interaction form in CSM Agent Workspace. Users with the customer service agent role (sn_customerservice_agent) can use Agent Assist to search for information from an interaction. By default, the available search sources include Knowledge articles, Service Catalog, and ServiceNow Community blogs and posts.

- Using Lookup and Verify in CSM workspaces:

Agents can use the lookup and verify feature in CSM workspaces.

CSM Configurable Workspace: agents search for contact or consumer information using the contextual side panel.

CSM Agent Workspace: agents search for contact or consumer information using the Verify Contact or Verify Consumer pop-up windows on the interaction form.
Only B is correct i think agent assist will available for Agent workspace

Selected Answer: BD
BD is Correct

questions.question_text: Customer service agents can use Agent Assist to search for information from an interaction. BY DEFAULT, what are the available search sources? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
About this task

Agent assist comes with default information sources it searches. You might change the information sources to provide more relevant information. Some of the resources Agent assist can search include:
Knowledge base
Service catalogs
Tables
Record producers

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-platform-user-interface/page/administer/workspace/task/set-up-agent-assist-information-sources.html

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC Is correct

questions.question_text: Which of the following are true regarding integrating a ServiceNow Knowledge base with external content? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Imported external articles appear as attachments in ServiceNow
choices.B: Only applications that allow WebDAV connections can be integrated
choices.C: The imported article will have the same category it had in the source knowledge base

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
This should be correct
Is asking about integration not OOB funtionality we know that we can create KB- Articles from a doc files but over integrations will be WebDAV
Correct answer is A and B

Selected Answer: AB
Answer:
 A. Imported external articles appear as attachments in ServiceNow
 B. Only applications that allow WebDAV connections can be integrated

Explanation:
 - "The acquire handler uses a WebDAV client to acquire external content to create articles." (b)
 - "a blank knowledge article is created and the external file is added as an attachment to the article." (a)
 - "The short description of the article is derived from the file name of the external content source."

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-servicenow-platform/page/product/knowledge-management/task/run-import-job-external-content-integration.html

Selected Answer: CD
correct answer is C & D
